content.raw:
Is the motivation for the change the fact that Ignition doesn't support this yet? Using the `model://` scheme to refer to other model's textures is a valid use case on Gazebo. It's usually a good idea to reduce duplication of resources stored. I think the best approach would be to add this support to Ignition. Besides being more efficient, it would help us not break backwards compatibility with models that are valid on Gazebo-classic. One more thing for @{557058:095b1e12-74ed-4e20-b44f-2f0745b616e0} to consider for the [Finding resources design](https://github.com/ignitionrobotics/design/pull/1). 

Also note that the ambulance is not the only one using the SUV wheels. `bus` and `fire_truck` also do. And other models, like `hatchback_red` and `hatchback_blue`, use the wheels from `hatchback`.

Is the motivation for the change the fact that Ignition doesn't support this yet? Using the model:// scheme to refer to other model's textures is a valid use case on Gazebo. It's usually a good idea to reduce duplication of resources stored. I think the best approach would be to add this support to Ignition. Besides being more efficient, it would help us not break backwards compatibility with models that are valid on Gazebo-classic. One more thing for @Nate Koenig to consider for the Finding resources design.

Also note that the ambulance is not the only one using the SUV wheels. bus and fire_truck also do. And other models, like hatchback_red and hatchback_blue, use the wheels from hatchback.
